article_title: Why Recalled Cars Stay on the Road
article_text:
In 2010, U.S. regulators began investigating fires in Jeep sport-utility vehicles. The probe eventually tied at least 51 deaths to fuel tanks that ignited in rear-end crashes. Chrysler Group LLC said the SUVs were safe but agreed a year ago to recall and repair 1.6 million Jeep Grand Cherokees and Libertys.

Almost none of them have been fixed.

The Jeep case shows how federal investigations into vehicles with suspected safety...

twitter.description: The Wall Street Journal examines how U.S. regulators as well as auto makers contribute to dangerous delays in car recalls.
twitter.creator: @MikeSpectorWSJ

article_summary:
In 2010, U.S. regulators began investigating fires in Jeep sport-utility vehicles.
The Jeep case shows how federal investigations into vehicles with suspected safety...
Chrysler Group LLC said the SUVs were safe but agreed a year ago to recall and repair 1.6 million Jeep Grand Cherokees and Libertys.
The probe eventually tied at least 51 deaths to fuel tanks that ignited in rear-end crashes.
Almost none of them have been fixed.
